result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter M Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$500.00 cash bond applied. 
In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Court grants Huber. May serve in Douglas County if at no cost to Barron County.

Court grants Huber. May serve in Douglas County if at no cost to Barron County.
Consecutive to: Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter M Thompson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of June 15 and 16, 2015 Jury Trial cancellation.
and stipulation for substitution of counsel.

Defendant Peter M Thompson in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Counsel presented.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.
State moves to amend Count 1 to 943.50(1m)(b) and add Count 4 - Misdemeanor Retail Theft.  Amended Information presented by State.  Court orders amendment to Count 1 and Count 4 added.
State relates joint agreement.   Defendant to testify against co-defendant at Trial.  Subpoena given to defendant by State.
Court questions defendant.  Court amends 2nd Information to add 939.05 PTAC for both Count 1 and Count 4.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1 and Count 4 as amended Misdemeanors, PTAC.  
Court accepts and finds Guilty on Count 1 and Count 4.
State relates recommendation.  Attorney Moldenhauer relates recommendation.
Defendant addresses Court.

Court relates and orders:
Count 1:
Jail: 30 days with huber - may be served in Douglas County if no cost to Barron County.  2 days jail credit.
Court Costs.

Count 4:
Jail: 30 days with huber - consecutive to Count 1 - may be served in Douglas County if no cost to Barron County.
Court Costs.

Defendant remanded to Jail.
Paul Moldenhauser.
5/5/15 Letter to Attorney Krave from Judge Boyle regarding plea hearing set for 6/1/15. Attorney Krave may appear by phone.
5/4/15 Letter to Judge Boyle from Attorney Krave requesting the plea hearing for 6/1/15 be rescheduled.
Jury trial at 06-15-2015 08:00 am

No agreement yet

Jury trial set for 6/15/2015 and 6/16/15 as jury trial #1 (two day jury trial).  
Final plea date set for 6/01/15 at 2:00 PM

Bond to continue in their present form.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Plea hearing at 04-22-2015 02:00 pm
3/30/15 Letter to Judge Babler from Attorney Krave regarding 4/29/15 hearing.

Defendant Peter M Thompson in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Reset based upon Attorney's non appearance.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Peter M Thompson in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Reset -  Plea hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Body Only - Wisconsin and Adjacent States.

Defendant Peter M Thompson in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup by telephone.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Bench Warrant Quashed;    Preliminary Hearing Waived  The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.    Probable Cause Found and Bound Over.   Information Filed.  Defense Waives formal reading of information;  
 Pleads not guilty.
  Plea hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Chris A. Gramstrup in court by telephone. Defendant Peter M Thompson not in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders  Bench Warrant  body only  Wisconsin and adjacent states.

8:31  Defendant appeared late.  Court was not able to reach Attorney Gramstrup.  Court may possibly hear the preliminary hearing later today.
Chris Gramstrup.
Bail/Bond.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Immediately report to Probation and do intake with probation.  Provide proof of reporting to probation, to the court,  by the time of preliminary hearing.
Must have no contact with Wal-Mart in Rice Lake WI.
No contact with co-defendants.

Defendant Peter M Thompson in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Defendant Peter M Thompson in custody.  Angela Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court quashes warrant on its own motion.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 08:00 am.
John Hinde
